intro: Phyteuma spicatum var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It features upright, slender stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, pink to purple flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, hairy texture, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. This variety is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and adaptability to temperate climates.
